info.description: The HTTP API for Event Store
info.title: Event Store HTTP API

get.description: Read a stream, receiving a standard AtomFeed document as a response.

parameters.name: stream
parameters.description: The stream ID

parameters.name: stream
parameters.description: The name of the new stream

parameters.name: streamItem
parameters.description: Stream to create

parameters.name: stream
parameters.description: The stream ID to delete

post.summary: An alternative URL to post events to
post.description: A URL generated by Event Store if you don't supply an ID when creating a stream. You then use this URL to post events to.

parameters.name: stream
parameters.description: The name of the stream

parameters.name: guid
parameters.description: Autogenerated UUID

get.description: Reads a single event from a stream.

parameters.name: stream
parameters.description: The stream ID

parameters.name: event
parameters.description: The event ID

get.description: Paginate backwards though stream events by a specified amount.

parameters.name: stream
parameters.description: The stream ID

parameters.name: event
parameters.description: The event ID

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: How many events to skip backwards from in the request.

get.description: Paginate backwards though stream events by a specified amount.

parameters.name: stream
parameters.description: The stream ID

parameters.name: event
parameters.description: The event ID

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: How many events to skip backwards from in the request.

get.description: Paginate forwards though stream events by a specified amount.

parameters.name: stream
parameters.description: The stream ID

parameters.name: event
parameters.description: The event ID

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: How many events to skip forwards in the request.

get.summary: Reads the metadata of a stream
get.description: Returns metadata of a stream, typically information associated with an event that is not part of the event.

parameters.name: stream
parameters.description: The stream ID

post.description: Update the metadata of a stream.

parameters.name: stream
parameters.description: The name of the stream

parameters.name: streamMetadataItem
parameters.description: Metadata object

get.summary: Returns all events from all streams
get.description: Returns all events from all streams, you must provide user details.

parameters.name: stream
parameters.description: The stream name

get.summary: Reads stream information via a persistent subscription

parameters.name: stream
parameters.description: The stream the persistent subscription is on

parameters.name: subscription
parameters.description: The name of the subscription group

get.summary: Reads a stream via a persistent subscription
get.description: By default, reading a stream via a persistent subscription will return a single event per request and will not embed the event properties as part of the response. Read [Reading Streams]({{site.baseurl}}/http-api/reading-streams) for information on the different embed levels.

parameters.name: stream
parameters.description: The stream the persistent subscription is on

parameters.name: subscription
parameters.description: The name of the subscription group

parameters.name: embed
parameters.description: Needed

post.description: You can edit the settings of an existing subscription while it is running. This will drop the current subscribers and will reset the subscription internally.

parameters.name: stream
parameters.description: The stream the persistent subscription is on

parameters.name: subscription
parameters.description: The name of the subscription group

parameters.name: subscriptionItem
parameters.description: Subscription to create

put.description: Before interacting with a subscription group, you need to create one. You will receive an error if you attempt to create a subscription group more than once. This requires [admin permissions](/server/access-control-lists).

parameters.name: stream
parameters.description: The stream the persistent subscription is on

parameters.name: subscription
parameters.description: The name of the subscription group

parameters.name: subscriptionItem
parameters.description: Subscription to create

parameters.name: stream
parameters.description: The stream the persistent subscription is on

parameters.name: subscription
parameters.description: The name of the subscription group

get.summary: Reads a stream via a persistent subscription and return a specific number of events
get.description: By default, reading a stream via a persistent subscription will return a single event per request and will not embed the event properties as part of the response. Read [Reading Streams]({{site.baseurl}}/http-api/reading-streams) for information on the different embed levels.

parameters.name: stream
parameters.description: The stream the persistent subscription is on

parameters.name: subscription
parameters.description: The name of the subscription group

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: How many events to return for the request.

post.description: Clients must acknowledge (or not acknowledge) messages in the competing consumer model. If the client fails to respond in the given timeout period, the message will be retried. You should use the `rel` links in the feed for acknowledgements not bookmark URIs as they are subject to change in future versions.

parameters.name: stream
parameters.description: The stream the persistent subscription is on

parameters.name: subscription
parameters.description: The name of the subscription group

parameters.name: messageid
parameters.description: The id of the message that needs to be acked

post.description: Clients must acknowledge (or not acknowledge) messages in the competing consumer model. If the client fails to respond in the given timeout period, the message will be retried. You should use the `rel` links in the feed for acknowledgements not bookmark URIs as they are subject to change in future versions.

parameters.name: stream
parameters.description: The stream the persistent subscription is on

parameters.name: subscription
parameters.description: The name of the subscription group

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: The ids of the messages that need to be acked separated by commas

post.description: Clients must acknowledge (or not acknowledge) messages in the competing consumer model. If the client fails to respond in the given timeout period, the message will be retried. You should use the `rel` links in the feed for acknowledgements not bookmark URIs as they are subject to change in future versions.

parameters.name: stream
parameters.description: The stream the persistent subscription is on

parameters.name: subscription
parameters.description: The name of the subscription group

parameters.name: messageid
parameters.description: The id of the message that needs to be nacked

parameters.name: action
parameters.description:
• **Park** - Don't retry the message, park it until a request is sent to reply the parked messages
  • **Retry** - Retry the message
  • **Skip** - Discard the message
  • **Stop** - Stop the subscription

post.description: Clients must acknowledge (or not acknowledge) messages in the competing consumer model. If the client fails to respond in the given timeout period, the message will be retried. You should use the `rel` links in the feed for acknowledgements not bookmark URIs as they are subject to change in future versions.

parameters.name: stream
parameters.description: The stream the persistent subscription is on

parameters.name: subscription
parameters.description: The name of the subscription group

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: The ids of the messages that need to be nacked separated by commas

parameters.name: action
parameters.description:
• **Park** - Don't retry the message, park it until a request is sent to reply the parked messages
  • **Retry** - Retry the message
  • **Skip** - Discard the message
  • **Stop** - Stop the subscription

post.summary: Replay any previously parked messages in a stream
post.description: Replay any previously parked messages in a stream that were parked by a negative acknowledgement action.

parameters.name: stream
parameters.description: The stream the persistent subscription is on

parameters.name: subscription
parameters.description: The name of the subscription group

startFrom.description: Which event position in the stream the subscription should start from

extraStatistics.description: Whether to track latency statistics on this subscription

checkPointAfterMilliseconds.description: The amount of time to try to checkpoint after

liveBufferSize.description: The size of the buffer (in-memory) listening to live messages as they happen before paging occurs

readBatchSize.description: The number of events to read per batch when reading the history

bufferSize.description: The number of events to cache when paging through history

maxCheckPointCount.description: The maximum number of messages not checkpointed before forcing a checkpoint

maxRetryCount.description: The maximum number of retries (due to timeout) before a message is considered to be parked

maxSubscriberCount.description: The maximum number of subscribers allowed

messageTimeoutMilliseconds.description: The amount of time after which to consider a message as timedout and retried

minCheckPointCount.description: The minimum number of messages to write to a checkpoint

namedConsumerStrategy.description: The strategy to use for distributing events to client consumers

startFrom.description: Which event position in the stream the subscription should start from

extraStatistics.description: Whether to track latency statistics on this subscription

checkPointAfterMilliseconds.description: The amount of time to try to checkpoint after

liveBufferSize.description: The size of the buffer (in-memory) listening to live messages as they happen before paging occurs

readBatchSize.description: The number of events to read per batch when reading the history

bufferSize.description: The number of events to cache when paging through history

maxCheckPointCount.description: The maximum number of messages not checkpointed before forcing a checkpoint

maxRetryCount.description: The maximum number of retries (due to timeout) before a message is considered to be parked

maxSubscriberCount.description: The maximum number of subscribers allowed

messageTimeoutMilliseconds.description: The amount of time after which to consider a message as timedout and retried

minCheckPointCount.description: The minimum number of messages to write to a checkpoint

namedConsumerStrategy.description: The strategy to use for distributing events to client consumers

readRole.description: The roles allowed to read the stream.

metaReadRole.description: The roles allowed to read the stream metadata.
